item.title: safe buffer back reference
item.description: TIL back references for sub, sub!, gsub, and gsub! are finally fixed for ActiveSupport::SafeBuffer through the use of block.binding.eval. The behaviour being fixed is: "foo123".html_safe.sub(/([a-z]+)([0-9]+)/) { $2 + $1 #=> NoMethodError: undefined method `+' for nil:NilClass } If this is confusing I recommend the following resource: Bindings in Ruby â€“ Behind the Magic of Blocks
